ratings.comment: She was by far my favorite professor this past semester. Email responses are super fast, turnaround on papers was lightning speed, and she was super flexible with students. She is one of those professors who is open to new ideas, too, so she won't judge you if you share an answer with the class that is either wrong or wasn't what she expected.

The class is a piece of cake.  Lectures are pretty much useless. Discussion section was useful.  The final project was easy but there was minimal guidance. The rubric for the final project was given out after most people had completed it which is frustrated because it was video project. She a big too carefree.  Nice lady though.

This class lacked rigor. Discussions were often banal - general reactions to the readings, or "how we felt," rather than pointed and intellectually useful. Organization was haphazard. She should challenge students more.

This was a class I was  excited for, but the overall experience was very poor. There is no organization to the class: changed reading schedules, work on a final project she hadn't entirely created yet. Also her lectures are very confusing. Everything feels like a tangent and its hard to know what's important. At the very least it was easy.

She was very disorganized and her lectures were basically pointless.  I could have not gone to any of the lectures and I would have been perfectly fine, seriously.  The final project was a joke because it's an online assignment where we make a website.  Lady, this is an English class.

Robin is the best professor I've ever had. She exhibits great passion in her teaching and has an extremely extensive knowledge of graphic novels and comics. She makes herself readily available to her students and is very responsive via email. It's obvious she cares about the well being of her students as she would always ask to make sure we weren't overwhelmed with the course load or any deadlines.

Prof. Valenza is clearly bright and dryly witty in a very entertaining way. While I will leave the class with a deeper appreciation of comics, I don't exactly think I learned too much, fomrally. I wish prof. Valenza had been a little more pedagogical. Most of the class was just "book club" style discussion. Would still recommend.
